title: Benefits of tough love in a relationship
text:
Next Story : Indulge in luxurious oils with Lakme Salon

First things first. How would you define 'tough love'? If you go by dictionary definitions, 'tough love', broadly speaking, is all about refusing to mollycoddle your partner, who has a problem, so that he or she can resolve the issue on his or her own. In other words, we set boundaries and restrictions for our partners for the sake of bringing positive changes in their lives. For instance, you want your partner to give up smoking and you put strict conditions for him - say, you will stop cooking him his favourite food if he doesn't kick the butt. So, tough love may involve some not-so-pleasing measures, but it can be benefit your relationship in the long run. Here's how:It shows that you have your partner's best interests in mind. In fact, tough love shows sincerity and transparency - you are willing to walk the extra mile and weather rough patches to help your partner lead a better life. It also shows you are serious about your relationship and not afraid to speak up when your partner has taken the wrong road. You just cannot mislead him. If that is not love, what is?Tough love shows that you are not blind to each other's faults. It also teaches you that since your relationship can't be roses, roses all the way, you need to accept each other's imperfections and work around them, even if that means not indulging each other too much. Disciplining each other can help you overcome many difficulties together. Tough love shows you a practical approach to relationships.Tough love can only help strengthen your core friendship, on which your relationship is built. It shows that like friends, you can deal with the harsh truths about each other. Your relationship isn't just about partying together or going on cloying, romantic dates. No relationship can possibly last without this kind of friendship and understanding.
description: Tough love may entail certain harsh measures and restrictions, but in the long run, it can only benefit your relationship. Here's how.
